The circus entertained Fire Nation and ${link_2} families alike by hosting acts from rope walkers, acrobats, and plate jugglers. It also featured a large collection of rare and exotic ${link_3}, including a ${link_4} and, at one point, a "${link_5}".
paragraphs.text: The Fire Nation circus was a group of traveling performers that gave demonstrations in various Fire Nation colonies and the Fire Nation. The circus entertained Fire Nation and Earth Kingdom families alike by hosting acts from rope walkers, acrobats, and plate jugglers. It also featured a large collection of rare and exotic animals, including a lion vulture and, at one point, a "wind buffalo".
Azula and a confident circus master viewed Ty Lee's performance.

paragraphs.body: After the ${link_0}, ${link_1} ${link_2} visited the circus, searching for her childhood friend ${link_3}, who had been employed there as a tightrope walker. After Ty Lee declined Azula's invitation to join her mission to capture ${link_4} and ${link_5}, the princess asked to see one of her performances. The circus hosted a private show in her honor, featuring an acrobatic performance by Ty Lee, who walked the tightrope while, under Azula's orders, the net was set aflame and the circus' entire menagerie ran loose. After this terrifying experience, Ty Lee decided to resign from the circus and join Azula on her quest.
paragraphs.text: After the surrender of Omashu, Princess Azula visited the circus, searching for her childhood friend Ty Lee, who had been employed there as a tightrope walker. After Ty Lee declined Azula's invitation to join her mission to capture Zuko and Iroh, the princess asked to see one of her performances. The circus hosted a private show in her honor, featuring an acrobatic performance by Ty Lee, who walked the tightrope while, under Azula's orders, the net was set aflame and the circus' entire menagerie ran loose. After this terrifying experience, Ty Lee decided to resign from the circus and join Azula on her quest.

paragraphs.body: Sometime later, the circus obtained ${link_0}, who had been kidnapped by ${link_1} in the ${link_2} and traded to some ${link_3}. The ${link_4} ordered the ${link_5} to tame Appa. The bison performed only once on stage as the "wind buffalo", as he later escaped during the same performance.
paragraphs.text: Sometime later, the circus obtained Appa, who had been kidnapped by sandbenders in the Si Wong Desert and traded to some beetle-headed merchants. The circus master ordered the circus trainer to tame Appa. The bison performed only once on stage as the "wind buffalo", as he later escaped during the same performance.

paragraphs.body: Even after the ${link_0}, the circus remained in business. To replace Ty Lee's acrobatic routine, the circus master hired her ${link_1}, who performed as the "Flying Ty Sisters". In 102 AG, the circus performed near the ${link_2} and ${link_3} took Ty Lee back there to catch a show. As they were back on their way out, the two warriors noticed two men who threatened to burn down the main tent after the circus master refused to do business with them. While Toph took down the ${link_4}, it took all seven Ty sisters to incapacitate the other man and save the circus from disaster.
paragraphs.text: Even after the Hundred Year War, the circus remained in business. To replace Ty Lee's acrobatic routine, the circus master hired her six identical sisters, who performed as the "Flying Ty Sisters". In 102 AG, the circus performed near the Fire Nation Capital and Toph took Ty Lee back there to catch a show. As they were back on their way out, the two warriors noticed two men who threatened to burn down the main tent after the circus master refused to do business with them. While Toph took down the firebender, it took all seven Ty sisters to incapacitate the other man and save the circus from disaster.
